identity.title: Diabetes guideline for AHRQ CDSC pilot
identity.description: Rules for managing outpatient adult diabetic patients

supportingReference.title: PHS PCHI Clinical Guidelines for the Treatment of Type 2 Diabetes in the Non-Pregnant Adult 2009

ApplicableScenario.title: Patient Focus
ApplicableScenario.description: This guideline applies to adult patient with Non Gestational Diabetes

Definition.title: adult patient
Definition.description: patient 18 years or older and has Non Gestational Diabetes

module.title: ASSESS
module.description: Rules for monitoring HgbA1c in patients with non gestational diabetes

ApplicableScenario.title: Overdue HgbA1c
ApplicableScenario.description: Most recent HgbA1c NOT < 6 months old

Recommendation.title: Order HgbA1c now (Recent poor diabetes control)
Recommendation.description: For poorly controlled diabetic patients, HgbA1c should be monitored more frequently than biannually

ApplicableScenario.title: High HgbA1c between 3 and 6 months old
ApplicableScenario.description: Most recent HgbA1c between 3 and 6 months old is > 7%

module.title: SCREEN
module.description: Rules to regularly screen diabetic patients for retinopthy, nephropathy, and peripheral neuropathy

Recommendation.title: Actions to consider for DM patients eye screening (Overdue Eye Exam)
Recommendation.description: Eye exams should be performed annually in patients with non gestational diabetes

Simple.title: Educate patient about diabetic eye care
Simple.description: Educate patient about diabetic eye care

Choice.title: Perform eye exam now, or refer to optometrist or ophthalmologist
Choice.description: Perform eye exam now, or refer to ophthalmologist

Simple.title: Refer to ophthalmologist for annual eye exam
Simple.description: Refer to ophthalmologist for annual eye exam

Simple.title: Refer to optometrist for annual eye exam
Simple.description: Refer to optometrist for annual eye exam

ApplicableScenario.title: No recent eye exam
ApplicableScenario.description: Last eye exam NOT < 1 year ago

Recommendation.title: Actions to consider for DM patients foot screening (Overdue Foot Exam)
Recommendation.description: Foot exams should be performed yearly in diabetic patients

Simple.title: Educate patient about diabetic foot care
Simple.description: Educate patient about diabetic foot care

Choice.title: Perform foot exam now, or refer to podiatrist
Choice.description: Perform foot exam now, or refer to podiatrist

Simple.title: Refer to podiatrist for annual foot exam
Simple.description: Refer to podiatrist for annual foot exam

ApplicableScenario.title: No recent foot exam
ApplicableScenario.description: Last foot exam NOT < 1 year ago

Recommendation.title: Proteinuria Screening (No recent Malb/Creat ratio)
Recommendation.description: Patients with non gestational diabetes should be screened for proteinuria annually

ApplicableScenario.title: No recent Malb/Creat Ratio
ApplicableScenario.description: Last Malb/Creat Ratio NOT < 1 year ago

module.title: MANAGE
module.description: Rules to medically manage diabetic patients.

Recommendation.title: Start ACE-I or ARB (Diabetic patient not on ACE-I or ARB therapy)
Recommendation.description: Diabetic patients should be on an ACE-I or ARB if not currently on ACE-I or ARB therapy.

ApplicableScenario.title: Diabetic Patient and not on ACEI or ARB therapy
ApplicableScenario.description: Diabetic patient not on ACEI or ARB therapy should start an ACEI or ARB
